4200/A0/05/001/006.headline: UNICEF Thailand&#39 s investment in technical assistance and advocacy for child sensitive social protection resulted in an expansion of the child support grant  which benefited 152 616 infants from poor families in 2016. Advocacy with partners also led to improved capacity to manage and implement the scheme.

4200/A0/05/002/019.indicator_name: Number of migrant-related fora per year in which UNICEF raised the issue of birth ragistration
4200/A0/05/002/019.headline: The Government continued to strengthen services to increase the birth registration rate among migrants. Data from the MoPH show that birth registration of migrants increased to 80.7 per cent in September 2016 from 73 per cent the previous year.

4200/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: percentage of mothers practicing 6-months of exclusive breastfeedig
percentage of households consuming iodised salt
yearly number of media stories related to the work of UNICEF in Thailand developed and disseminated
Increase in score on a Thailand-specific index (to be developed) by 100 per cent between 2011 and 2016 for both the public and decision-makers

Best Start campaign launched to public awareness on the importance of fully implementing the new early childhood development policy  which includes exclusive breastfeeding  universal birth registration  expansion of early learning and getting children into school at age six.
Salt iodization quality assurance system established to ensure standard iodization levels.

Early Childhood Development policy approved by Cabinet  salt iodization regulations being enforced   BMS Code Act adopted by National Health Assembly and approved by Cabinet and Parliament  increase in the criminal age of responsibility from 10 to 12  ratification of Optional protocol 3 and lifting of reservation to Article 22  and improved enforcement of existing laws and regulations governing media coverage of children.

Sufficient budget and resources to implement ECD policy  sufficient budget allocated for monitoring of salt industry iodization efforts and for iodine levels in population  sufficient budget allocation for BMS Code monitoirng and reporting.

National ECD Committee assigned coordination of ECD policy implementation  key players involved in IDD/USI efforts  including FDA  Institute of Nutrition  DOH  etc.  work together to coordinate USI effort  working group established to develop strategy to push for passge of BMS Code Act  with support from the Thai Breastfeeding Association.

Only iodized salt available for purchase  BMS Code Act approved and enforced  thereby greatly curbing the unethical marketing practices of BMS industry and resulting in more mothers choosing to exclusively breastfeed.
